articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: More Americans evacuated from coronavirus epicenter in China
articles.description: Hundreds of Americans will soon arrive in Texas and Nebraska where they’ll be quarantined for 14 days and checked every 12 hours for signs of the coronavirus. The death toll is climbing in China, with more than 400 killed — including the doctor who first warn…

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: What you should know about coronavirus
articles.description: Coronavirus is a fast-spreading virus that originated in China. The global death toll has reached over 500 people. NBC News’ Dr. John Torres explains what the coronavirus is, its symptoms, and what precautions you should take.

articles.author: Leticia Miranda
articles.title: Amid bitter trade war with China, U.S. companies pledge millions of dollars in aid
articles.description: “When there is a disaster in a place where they operate, they donate. Obviously they get positive publicity in China for these contributions. But it’s not about the publicity; it’s about doing the right thing,” said one trade expert.
articles.content: Despite a bitter and protracted trade war with China, U.S.-based multinational companies are pledging millions of dollars to support relief efforts during the coronavirus epidemic, with donations ranging from surgical masks and gowns to food and research for … [+4056 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: WHO pays tribute after death of Chinese doctor who warned of coronavirus
articles.description: The World Health Organization responds to the death of Dr. Li Wenliang, paying tributes to the doctors efforts to care for patients. Dr. Wenliang previously was reprimanded by police for pushing for coronavirus warnings in December, and recently contracted th…

articles.author: Henry Austin, Jane Weaver
articles.title: Doctor punished for coronavirus warnings dies from disease, WHO confirms
articles.description: Dr. Li Wenliang who was punished by police for online warnings about the coronavirus, has died from the illness, the World Health Organization confirmed.
articles.content:
A prominent Chinese doctor who was punished by police when he tried to warn his fellow medics about the coronavirus has died from the disease, officials at the World Health Organization have confirmed.
Dr. Li Wenliang, 34, had posted information about the ou… [+1267 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Coronavirus fears turn Beijing’s busiest streets into a ghost town
articles.description: A Western journalist traveled from his Beijing home to a busy shopping mall during the Thursday morning rush hour – and encountered almost no one.

articles.author: NBC News
articles.title: Coronavirus updates: Global death toll jumps to 565
articles.description: As global death toll from novel coronavirus reaches at least 565, here is the latest you need to know.
articles.content:
Global death toll rises to at least 565 as confirmed cases reach more than 28,000 in mainland China

articles.author: Tim Morrison
articles.title: Coronavirus tests U.S. medical system's unhealthy reliance on China for drugs, supplies
articles.description: Coronavirus from China highlight's U.S. medical system's unhealthy reliance on the Asian power for drugs and medical supplies.
articles.content: Chinese President Xi Jinping recently warned of the grave situation posed by the accelerating spread of the coronavirus in China. Xis frank warnings were unusual for the seniormost official of the Chinese Community Party and reveal the depth of the concern at… [+6247 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Americans arrive in U.S. from Wuhan, China amid coronavirus concerns
articles.description: Chartered cargo planes carrying Americans arrived at two secure military bases in California. The hundreds on board are now beginning a 14-day quarantine, and the CDC said two more flights will soon be heading to Texas and Nebraska.
